crmPack 0.2.8
  • Reference

Get the fitted DLT free survival (piecewise exponential model). This function returns a data frame with dose, middle, lower and upper quantiles for the PEM curve. If hazard=TRUE,

fitPEM.Rd

Get the fitted DLT free survival (piecewise exponential model). This function returns a data frame with dose, middle, lower and upper quantiles for the PEM curve. If hazard=TRUE,

fitPEM(object, model, data, npiece = data@npiece, Tmax = data@Tmax,
  quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975), middle = mean, hazard = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for Samples,DALogisticLogNormal,DataDA
fitPEM(object, model, data,
  npiece = data@npiece, Tmax = data@Tmax, quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975),
  middle = mean, hazard = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

object

mcmc samples
model

the mDA-CRM model
data

the data input, a DataDA class object
npiece

the number of pieces in the PEM todo: do we need this param?
Tmax

the DLT observation period todo: do we need this param?
quantiles

the quantiles to be calculated (default: 0.025 and 0.975)
middle

the function for computing the middle point. Default: mean
hazard

should the the hazard over time be plotted based on the PEM? (not default) Otherwise (default) todo: what will be plotted?...
…

additional arguments for methods

Methods (by class)

  • object = Samples,model = DALogisticLogNormal,data = DataDA: This method works for the DALogisticLogNormal model class.

Examples

data <- DataDA(x=c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6, 10, 10, 10),
               y=c(0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0),
               doseGrid=
                 c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6,
                   seq(from=10, to=80, by=2)),
               u=c(42,30,15,5,20,25,30,60),
               t0=c(0,-15,-30,-40,-55,-70,-75,-85),
               Tmax=60,
               npiece=10)
#> Error in DataDA(x = c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6, 10, 10, 10), y = c(0, 0, 1,     1, 0, 0, 1, 0), doseGrid = c(0.1, 0.5, 1.5, 3, 6, seq(from = 10,     to = 80, by = 2)), u = c(42, 30, 15, 5, 20, 25, 30, 60),     t0 = c(0, -15, -30, -40, -55, -70, -75, -85), Tmax = 60,     npiece = 10): could not find function "DataDA"


npiece_=10
Tmax_=60

lambda_prior<-function(k){
  npiece_/(Tmax_*(npiece_-k+0.5))
}

model<-DALogisticLogNormal(mean=c(-0.85,1),
                           cov=matrix(c(1,-0.5,-0.5,1),nrow=2),
                           refDose=56,
                           l=as.numeric(t(apply(as.matrix(c(1:npiece_),1,npiece_),2,lambda_prior))),
                           C_par=2)
#> Error in DALogisticLogNormal(mean = c(-0.85, 1), cov = matrix(c(1, -0.5,     -0.5, 1), nrow = 2), refDose = 56, l = as.numeric(t(apply(as.matrix(c(1:npiece_),     1, npiece_), 2, lambda_prior))), C_par = 2): could not find function "DALogisticLogNormal"

#Obtain the posterior

options <- McmcOptions(burnin=10,
                       step=2,
                       samples=1e2)

set.seed(94)
samples <- mcmc (data,model,options)
#> Error in mcmc(data, model, options): object 'model' not found


# Extract the posterior mean hazard (and empirical 2.5 and 97.5 percentile) 
# for the piecewise exponential model
# If hazard=FALSE, the posterior PEM will be plot 
fitted  <- fitPEM(object = samples,
                  model = model,
                  data=data,
                  quantiles=c(0.025,0.975),
                  middle=mean,
                  hazard=TRUE)
#> Error in fitPEM(object = samples, model = model, data = data, quantiles = c(0.025,     0.975), middle = mean, hazard = TRUE): could not find function "fitPEM"
